creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three leafy brooch designs on sheet: L design features wide-leafed vines with a face emerging from center leaf; center design shows a vase emerging from intertwined leaves, with two swirls flanking the vase; R design features nude torso emerging from vines, with male heads emerging from leaves flanking center motif
inscription:
Signature, Date, Label

label on mat: Christopher Mendez 51 Lexington Street London W1R 4HL
provenance: [Christopher Mendez, London; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, top edge: [AG / 1536]
text: Heinrich Aldegrever devoted a third of his 300 or so engravings to ornament. This sheet exemplifies the Renaissance impulse toward symmetry and crowding. Goldsmiths would have freely recombined these foliated elements to suit their customers’ tastes.
title: Three Brooches Side by Side
